author: sky.cactus
content: Ethereum (and blockchains in general) is not good at storing large amounts of data.

author: sky.cactus
content: In fact, they are arguably one of the least efficient data storage systems and storing data on Ethereum should be avoided whenever possible.

author: sky.cactus
content: All censorship resistant blockchains are bad at storing state.  If you are okay with censorable, then you can just build a public centralized journaling DB with signed transactions.  I would estimate a strong team of 4 could build a prototype in a couple months, and a production thing in a year or two.
